cyclone.name: BETA
cyclone.current_location: about 140 miles SE of Galveston, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: Very slow west-northwest motion toward the central Texas coast followed by a turn north- then northeastward, taking the weakening system inland across Louisiana and toward Mississippi late Wed–Thu
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Texas coast near Port O'Connor/Matagorda Bay

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch from Baffin Bay to Port Aransas, TX
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning Port Aransas, TX to Morgan City, LA; Storm Surge Warning Port Aransas, TX to Rockefeller Wildlife Refuge, LA
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Storm-surge inundation 1–3 ft possible Rockefeller Wildlife Refuge, LA eastward to Ocean Springs, MS (includes Mississippi coast near Pascagoula)
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions possible mid-week; chance of sustained winds 25–35 mph remains very low (≤3%)
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–3 ft inundation possible along the Mississippi coast including Pascagoula as persistent on-shore flow sets up Tue–Thu
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of rain possible Wed–Fri with localized higher totals; flash-flood risk especially in poor-drainage areas of the port
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornado risk in outer rain bands; dangerous rip currents along adjacent beaches
